revised_title: Correcting Errors in Linear Measure Due to Bar Thickness
tldr: The author, Henry Kater, discovered an error in standards of linear measure arising from the thickness of the bar on which they were traced. He conducted experiments and devised a method to correct this error, which involved using a piano-wire to detect surface irregularities and constructing a scale to minimize the error. This method could be applied to various useful purposes when a straight edge was required.
